Hello all,

I'd like to test my XSL stylesheets that I use for generating the HTML
front end to our app (we use Struts CX).  I've grabbed XMLUnit for
JUnit and have set up a basic XMLTestCase, however the biggest problem
I have now is dealing with my files included by the XSL under test.

So this question may be more about structuring development directories
than actually using XMLUnit.

From my project's root in my development environment, I have my XSL
files in this directory:

./web/xsl/html4/<my XSL files here>
./web/xsl/html4/include/<common files I include in 'base' XSL files>

Where . is the root of the project as checked out from my version
control (other subdirectories besides /web are /src, /test, /lib,
etc.)

But my XSL include files are written to access the include directory
assuming they are being executed from the web application context --
that is, here's a sample include line:

<xsl:include href="/WEB-INF/xsl/html4/includes/commonIncl.xsl"/>


When I run XMLUnit on my XSL file, the above line fails as the
transformer can't find the resource
file:/WEB-INF/xsl/html4/includes/commonIncl.xsl.


How do you normally structure your build directories or handle this
include problem when testing XSL files outside of the container?

Thanks for your advice, and Happy New Year,

Dan
